title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Tartelettes [Little Tarts], for the Service des Objets de Desserts [Dessert Service], 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Tartelettes [Little Tarts], for the Service des Objets de Desserts [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, bursh and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Les Tartelettes
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Scene outside a pastry shop.  A man wearing apron, right middleground, offers a selection of tarts from a tray to a young boy and girl, center middleground.  An elegantly dressed woman, left foreground, possibly their mother, appears to be telling the children to take only one tart.  A woman holding a baby, center middleground, holds a tart which the baby is trying to reach.  Two platters and a compote stand filled with tarts in right foreground, are displayed on a shelf next to the shop entrance from which a striped awning hangs.  A carriage and driver, left rearground, await the family.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Tartelettes [Little Tarts], for the Service des Objets de Desserts [Dessert Service], 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, bursh and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper. 
1989-13-29.
